tripleplay.ui

Class Interface

  • java.lang.Object
    • tripleplay.ui.Interface
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Paintable

    public class Interface
extends Object
implements Paintable
    The main class that integrates the Triple Play UI with a PlayN game. This class is mainly necessary to automatically validate hierarchies of Elements during each paint. Create an interface instance, create Root groups via the interface and add the Element.layers into your scene graph wherever you desire.

    Call update(int) and paint(playn.core.util.Clock) from Game.Default.update(int) and Game.Default.paint(float) to drive your interface.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Interface.Task
      A time based task that requires an update per frame.
      static interface  Interface.TaskHandle
      An object that can be used to remove a previously added task.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Interface

        public Interface()

    • Method Detail

      • deferAction

        public void deferAction(Runnable action)
        Posts a runnable that will be executed after the next time the interface is validated. Processing deferred actions is not tremendously efficient, so don't call this every frame.

      • addTask

        public Interface.TaskHandle addTask(Interface.Task task)
        Adds a task that will henceforth be updated once per game update. If a task is added during the task update iteration, it will be updated for the first time on the following game update.
        Returns:
        a handle that will remove the task when invoked the first time. Subsequent invocations will do nothing.

      • update

        public void update(int delta)
        Updates the elements in this interface. Normally called from Game.Default.update(int).

      • paint

        public void paint(Clock clock)
        "Paints" the elements in this interface. Normally called from Game.Default.paint(float).
        Specified by:
        paint in interface Paintable

      • roots

        public Iterable<Root> roots()
        Returns an iterable over the current roots. Don't delete from this iterable!

      • animator

        public Animator animator()
        Returns an animator that can be used within the scope of this interface.

      • createRoot

        public Root createRoot(Layout layout,
                       Stylesheet sheet)
        Creates a root element with the specified layout and stylesheet.

      • createRoot

        public Root createRoot(Layout layout,
                       Stylesheet sheet,
                       GroupLayer parent)
        Creates a root element with the specified layout and stylesheet and adds its layer to the specified parent.

      • addRoot

        public <R extends Root> R addRoot(R root)
        Adds a root to this interface. The root must have been created with this interface and not be added to any other interfaces. Generally you should use createRoot(tripleplay.ui.Layout, tripleplay.ui.Stylesheet), but this method is exposed for callers with special needs.

      • removeRoot

        public boolean removeRoot(Root root)
        Removes the supplied root element from this interface, iff it's currently added. If the root's layer has a parent, the layer will be removed from the parent as well. This leaves the Root's layer in existence, so it may be used again. If you're done with the Root and all of the elements inside of it, call destroyRoot(tripleplay.ui.Root) to free its resources.
        Returns:
        true if the root was removed, false if it was not currently added.

      • destroyRoot

        public boolean destroyRoot(Root root)
        Removes the supplied root element from this interface and destroys its layer, iff it's currently added. Destroying the layer destroys the layers of all elements contained in the root as well. Use this method if you're done with the Root. If you'd like to reuse it, call removeRoot(tripleplay.ui.Root) instead.
        Returns:
        true if the root was removed and destroyed, false if it was not currently added.

      • destroyRoots

        public void destroyRoots()
        Removes and destroys all roots in this interface.
